## Natural history notes

The Creeping Cucumber (Melothria pendula) is a plant. It resembles the cultivated cucumber, possessing miniature yellow flowers, similar leaf shape, same leaf patterns, as well as similar growth patterns. The berries, when unripe and light green can be eaten raw. The unripe berries strongly resemble minuscule watermelons. Dogs are known to eat the leaves without any apparent side effects.
